page.title: 04FARMING - DAIRY
page.content: {BARNTON AND LITTLE LEIGH 03600375} FARMING 3.DAIRY - The most common breed of cattle is Friesian. The average number of milking cows per farm is 94.Each farm breeds large numbers of heifers, the average being 52 per farm.These beasts are kept 12 months and are then sent to markets at Chelford or Beeston or are kept as milking stock.Farms keep at least one bull either Hereford stock (for cross breeding) or pure Friesian.The average milk yield per cow in this area is between l5 and l6 litres per day.The cows are milked twice daily 6.30 a.m. and 4.30p.m.Milk is collected by tanker once a day.Yield varies according to the season; the highest yield is in the late spring and early summer when rich pasture is available.
